intro: Cyanea pilosa, commonly known as the hairy Cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cyanea pilosa typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a keystone species in certain habitats.
